reviews.review_msg: Prof Cox is definitely very knowledgeable about the subject. Though as a 400-seminar, wasn't much discussion. 1 final paper + in-class presentation. His exams make you think (not direct memorize-spew of info), and he adequately prepares you with his in-depth notes. Easily accessible for questions (responds e-mails pretty quick). Fair grader
Very nice professor, very knowledgeable about econ!! The mids and final are easy, no attendance no presentation. Especially, David is very handsome!

He is one of the greatest profs I have ever had. He is very knowledgeable and passionate about Econ.  His lecture notes are very clear and if you attend all his classes and listen to his lectures you will definitely do great in his class.

David never respected his students and class notes are very unorganized.This instructor was very lazy and impatient. Even I got c in this course, i am regret because learned nothing in his course. Avoid cost, never take this worse instructor course.

His 400 level class is not very good. I've never got any grade lower than B in all econ classes. I received my first C from this prof. His notes are not clear. David likes to question students individually in the lecture. He made fun of students when they answered incorrectly. Exam questions are not clear and tough. please avoid at all cost.

He might be ok teaching 300 level classes, but his true personality shows in his 400 level classes. Most of the students in his class hates his attitudes(or all?). Disrespects students, very impatient, blame exam outcome on students, criticize students intellengence, VERY UNORGANIZED!! Definitely avoid his 400 level class, or yet just avoid him.

An OK teacher, but very poor examiner. Not clear on questions. Taught slower than a snail. Half the class time was used to "review" the material from last class. Don't even bother asking him to clarify things on midterms. Would not recommend him for 410.
bad manner!!! please respect your students!!
He makes the whole class seem incompetent and he's very impolite during his office hours.
He's tough but you'll leave the class w/ a wealth of knowledge.A great lecturer!
tricky exam questions. what he put on exam is always NOT what he taught!!

Honestly, I don't come to this site and comment on profs, but for him, I have to !!! He is SO BAD...expect too much from students, and ask  us to do the presentation just to show how knowledgable you are??? So rude to students, you think you know everything, why don't you teach at Haward...plz be out of SFU ASAP..such a stupid teacher

I took him for 210 too and thought he was bad, But 410 turns out to be better. His notes was clear (warning u have to hand write notes for every lecture)and u can go to his office for extra help on projects. This is just my opinion though cause the average of the class midterm was a failing grade.

My last SFU course, and hands down the coolest prof with the most engaging (but still challenging) lectures I've had. I know I'm not a star student, but he made me feel like some people here actually care about us.
I would like to say that he is a good person and the great marker :)
